title: Approaches to Learning through Play – Constructing, Organizing, and Applying Knowledge
subject: Learning Standards for Early Childhood (2024-)

document.title: Pennsylvania Learning Standards for Early Childhood PRE-KINDERGARTEN

46F9CC2606164FAEA45E33E8A94A24BF.description: Demonstrate increasing flexibility in a variety of situations, task, and activities .

F3F2C8C72CB84213B0D28AD8BDEAB172.description: Observe mistakes and note the effectiveness of a different solution (e .g ., “That didn’t work because …”) .

A4D76D22984B4E71A90CB7A043D6DA80.description: Change plan if a better strategy presents itself .

547D27F712564D97B2708F4C94F5FED8.description: Recall and use a previously successful strategy .

0FFCD529760443689E2B286A890A474B.description: Discuss the different ways used to accomplish a task or to solve a problem .

060627BFB5FD47F79E96747CF30C48CE.description: Attempt to complete a task in more than one way (e .g ., using materials in new ways, trial and error, breaking tasks into steps) before asking for help or stopping due to frustration .

4360AC09C9414B3181A2FAB9DFF5BBBC.description: Try new ways to complete a familiar task .

10085E3C8BFA457D8776F867DD02A031.description: Attempt problem- solving activities to achieve a positive outcome.

238A0BE1373E44F7951CFF5C59875EFE.description:
Recognize that everyone makes mistakes and that using positive coping skills
can result in learning from the experience.

FC6B5E4F013F4EA8A4C67A930692C20D.description: Apply a skill to multiple tasks (e .g ., use measuring cups in sensory table, outside, and in cooking activity)

B0B70D85D44D416C8C161FE984388DF7.description: Practice skills learned in whole group demonstration or role-play during center exploration .

4F7BF583F3FC432AB9B5B44A1F7D5800.description: Share new skills or tasks learned or practiced outside of school setting (e .g ., “Mommy taught me how to tie my shoe,” demonstrate a forward roll that was learned in a weekend gymnastics class) .

11E37B45B2B5495F8EF7C09BE5C20DAE.description: Understand that appropriate activities and events may differ from home to school .

E125BBBE39BE492FA0D924C01B9BD835.description: Relate personal (e .g ., home, cultural, community) experiences during play, and other school activities .

F806622163E5492FA7B7E19C0EB71B2B.description:
Relate knowledge learned from
one experience to a similar experience in a new setting.

D164AEF5FA77495093EC1A8122F28B38.description: Use real life objects to represent make- believe or fantasy objects (e .g ., spoon for a magic wand, broom for a flying horse) .

F7C272387F7A48E282956E108F5DF6E6.description: Use non-conforming objects to create representations of real life objects or activities (e .g ., block for a phone, stick for a spoon) .

9CF539CF744C4840B6DA48B32EEB863E.description: Use materials and objects to represent new concepts.

A75C0059D73A4BD48291DBA33390948F.description: Answer questions to explain the purpose of a creation .

85AC9C97975F409FB01427503044120C.description: Describe or draw a desired product (e .g ., create a blueprint for a block structure) .

7436449B4D474784909EFE3DF4D67358.description: Engage in a variety of creative activities .

43C6A7D084504BE8A4E53FAD28FE9523.description: Produce and explain the purpose for a new creation.

2E50BD5F85ED44169765B369C3A88A04.description: Use music, art, and/or stories to express ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

B0B8808581AE4CCC8666603FD5912D35.description: Recall details from stories, events, and experiences .

34E2D3A091024C7F9E791784A5992E89.description: Remember and update simple information (e .g ., one’s place in a story, song, or game if interrupted) .

A90BFF18005B403190FFE3BD65F5F7D1.description: Relate information and/or experiences from the past .

69E9077D3D464C24AF25AB962C040823.description:
Retain and recall information presented over
a short period of time.

D6AC1B868AE84B8ABB142F004212FD00.description: Practice extending simple repeating patterns using manipulatives .

0211E1B2620640A3A525CD8366527AB6.description: Identify patterns in the environment (e .g ., stripes on a flag) .

BEED68749B184F67B5D66DB3EC1F9C6F.description: Show pride in completion of a challenging task .

1281FCA5C67C4277905AF0DA8DCCDBE9.description: Stick to a task after stating frustration .

3F44739F8B7D49878010A242D5B339D6.description: Attempt to complete a task in more than one way (e .g ., using materials in new ways, trial and error, breaking tasks into steps) before asking for help or stopping due to frustration .

DE63BF795D83447F86FF9624046C375B.description: Attempt to accomplish challenging tasks by employing familiar and new strategies as needed.

6DE0FCE9151E4CED927AFF528FB367D9.description: Relate the desired outcome or end goal of a task or activity

968C2E378C30456C8D1D22449948B30A.description: Relate the steps necessary to complete a task or activity .

4A3AB9E1B45C4933803928753539FE52.description: Attend and follow through on two-step directions .

2C47C5FB918840099906CA1B855988A7.description: Independently break simple tasks into steps and complete them one at a time.

FB210559C6484AFCA2486131B0307F40.description: Move away from distractions to complete a task .

511B77EB47284E52AB30DBD6CD0C5A3A.description: State when they are frustrated by a challenge .

DD9CC61527D3435795D4D5142D4D977B.description: State when they are being distracted .

1D3DA64DD404405A8F79EDE25D9E6D12.description: Work toward completing a task, even if challenging, and despite interruptions.

0A5B9620D6AF421B8B74FFBBEAF112BE.description: Engage in simple games with rules with adult reminders and support .

045252955AC043F7915221A4FCB2FC99.description: Incorporate personal experiences and themes learned into play scenarios .

ACA7EEE900784AF7AAF9F67BAA85EFBF.description: Extend play scenarios over more than one day .

C078F4A88F1C4FB0902EAEFFD08E6504.description: office scenario, assigning a doctor and patients) .

171207580B754D99937500B399BD214F.description: Initiate cooperative play with peers by establishing roles and a simple play scenario (e .g ., act out a doctor’s

1B0C4EB2EBED415BAFC34B2505B7999B.description: Use materials and objects to represent other objects .

85C50B9FA6704833B1DD83FA2E8497D1.description: Engage in complex play sequences with two or more children.

7E8B9497609541C7ACD219DE20C25BDD.description: Differentiate between appropriate and inappropriate methods for learning information (e .g ., understand that jumping from a high wall is a dangerous way to discover its height) .

69295DE6EA6D4F1D8FEEFF15288E5ED1.description: State discomfort at trying something new, but make attempts to try after encouragement .

84E4872B37D54D34B91E75A38D9598C4.description: Listen attentively to learn proper technique for a new skill, and then follow through using the learned technique .

D1713C81279D4C18B602C9B34139661B.description: Observe peers engaged in an unfamiliar or new activity before joining in .

01589FCBD5C24D7589F7ED07C473FE74.description: Actively explore new materials that are introduced into the classroom .

59EB6753E33341D1819EB206AEF2E146.description: Demonstrate a willingness to participate in new and challenging experiences.

0ED8B1A8425C4210976EDC72B7A58190.description: Watch others play and ask to join in

16DAE1EC322B44898E626E557CCFAD57.description: Ask questions to understand something (e .g ., “How does that work?”) .

E49D71EDFBFA49EE87006659B64244FA.description: Demonstrate interest in new materials and experiences that are introduced into the classroom .

A0D7FA8758A34BA4A87BC99A9D423B74.description: Show interest and interact with others about their work or actions .

7194234D8A1C43C3B8DC4D9AC0ADD9AD.description: Use senses to explore and learn from the environment .

508E19C5F8704AA4B1D93D96512DE5D1.description: Explore and ask questions to seek meaningful information about a growing range of topics, ideas, and tasks.
